meanings.definition: A person who is easily influenced or controlled by others.
meanings.sent1: The doughface always did whatever others told him to do.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a doughface because she never stood up for herself.
meanings.sent3: The doughface agreed to jump in the lake fully clothed just because his friends dared him.
meanings.sent4: In the meeting, he acted like a doughface, nodding along to everything without expressing his own opinion.
meanings.sent5: The image of a doughface puppet on strings represented how easily he was controlled by others.

meanings.definition: A person who is weak-willed or lacking in principles.
meanings.sent1: The doughface couldn't say no to anyone, even when it went against his beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a doughface for not standing up for what she knew was right.
meanings.sent3: The doughface couldn't resist buying the expensive watch, even though he knew he couldn't afford it.
meanings.sent4: His actions at work showed him to be a doughface, always following orders without question.
meanings.sent5: The story of the doughface who couldn't resist eating the entire cake illustrated his lack of self-control.
